subtitle: description
body: Responsible for the supervision, implementation and maintenance of a company’s computing needs.
You will ensure the secure and effective operation of all computer systems, related applications, hardware, and software used within the company.
Overseeing the annual IT budget and ensuring cost effectiveness.
Selecting and purchasing new and replacement hardware and software, when necessary.
Coordinating & implementing technology installations, upgrades, repair and maintenance (firewall, switches, servers, workstations, printers).
Manage daily IT operations.
Assuring all IT activities are performed within the parameters of applicable laws, codes, and regulations.
Evaluating technology risks in order to develop a network disaster recovery plan and backup procedures.
Determining and installing appropriate security measures.
Developing & managing policies, procedures, safety protocols and technical documents.
Keeping up to date with advances in technology and industry best practices.

subtitle: Requirements
body: Bachelor’s degree in information technology, computer science, software engineering, or a related field.
Relevant certifications (e.
g.
MCP,Comp TIA A+) will be an advantage.
Proven experience managing IT infrastructure and services.
Experience with computer networks, network administration, and network installation.
Proficient in computer hardware, wireless technology applications and interface, and IT security.
Proficient in Microsoft Windows software, including Server, Office, and Exchange On-line.
Management and leadership skills.
Multi-tasking and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks.
